相.definition: appearance; portrait; picture; government minister; (physics) phase; (literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features); to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

相中.definition: to find to one's taste; to pick (after looking at); Taiwan pr. [xiang4 zhong4]

相互保證毀滅.pinyin: xiang1 hu4 bao3 zheng4 hui3 mie4

相交.definition: to cross over (e.g. traffic); to intersect; to make friends

相伴.definition: to accompany sb; to accompany each other

相依為命.definition: mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival; interdependent

相信.definition: to believe; to be convinced; to accept as true

相傳.definition: to pass on; to hand down; tradition has it that ...; according to legend

相像.definition: to resemble one another; to be alike; similar

相公.definition: lord; master; young gentleman; male prostitute; catamite; mahjong player disqualified by unintentionally taking in the wrong number of dominoes; (old form of address for one's husband) husband

相切.definition: (math.) to be tangential to each other

相加.definition: to add up (numbers); (fig.) to put together (several things of the same type, e.g. skills)

相助.definition: to help one another; to come to sb's help

相勸.definition: to persuade; to exhort; to advise

相合.definition: to conform to; to fit with; to be compatible with

相向突擊.definition: sudden attack from the opposite direction (idiom)

相吸.definition: mutual attraction (e.g. electrostatic); to attract one another

相城.definition: see 相城區|相城区[Xiang4cheng2 Qu1]

相城區.definition: Xiangcheng, a district of Suzhou City 蘇州市|苏州市[Su1zhou1 Shi4], Jiangsu

相士.definition: fortune-teller who uses the subject's face for his prognostication

相夫教子.definition: to assist one's husband and educate the children (idiom); the traditional roles of a good wife

相好.definition: to be intimate; close friend; paramour

相對.definition: relatively; opposite; to resist; to oppose; relative; vis-a-vis; counterpart

相對象.definition: to meet a possible marriage partner

相山.definition: Xiangshan, a district of Huaibei City 淮北市[Huai2bei3 Shi4], Anhui

相山區.definition: Xiangshan, a district of Huaibei City 淮北市[Huai2bei3 Shi4], Anhui

相左.definition: to fail to meet each other; to conflict with each other; to be at odds with

相幫.definition: to help one another; to aid

相干.definition: relevant; to have to do with; (physics) (of light etc) coherent

相得益彰.definition: to bring out the best in each other (idiom); to complement one another well

相悖.definition: contrary; opposite; to run counter to

相愛相殺.definition: to have a love-hate relationship with each other

相應.definition: to correspond; answering (one another); to agree (among the part); corresponding; relevant; appropriate; (modify) accordingly

相抵.definition: to balance up; to offset; to counterbalance

相持.definition: locked in a stalemate; to confront one another

相持不下.definition: at a stalemate; deadlocked; in unrelenting mutual opposition

相接.definition: to merge with; interlinking; to join with; to interlock

相提並論.definition: to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms; to place on a par with; (often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)

相撞.definition: collision; crash; to crash together; to collide with; to bump into

相敬如賓.definition: to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom); mutual respect between husband and wife

相斥.definition: mutual repulsion (e.g. electrostatic); to repel one another

相映成趣.definition: to set each other off nicely

相望.definition: to look at one another; to face each other

相機.definition: camera (abbr. for 照相機|照相机[zhao4 xiang4 ji1]); at the opportune moment; as the circumstances allow

相機而動.definition: to wait for the opportune moment before taking action (idiom)

相機而行.definition: to act according to the situation (idiom)

相沿成習.definition: well established; accepted as a result of long usage

相濡以沫.definition: lit. (of fish) to moisten each other with spittle (when out of the water) (idiom); fig. to share meager resources and support each other in times of difficulty

相爭.definition: to vie against one another; to fight each other; mutual aggression

相當.definition: equivalent to; appropriate; considerably; to a certain extent; fairly; quite

相看.definition: to look at one another; to take a good look at; to look upon

相稱.definition: to match; to suit; mutually compatible

相約.definition: to agree (on a meeting place, date etc); to reach agreement; to make an appointment

相罵.definition: to hurl insults at each other

相若.definition: on a par with; comparable to

相處.definition: to be in contact (with sb); to associate; to interact; to get along (well, poorly)

相襯.definition: to contrast; to set off one another; to go well with

相見.definition: to see each other; to meet in person

相見恨晚.definition: to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally.; It feels like we have known each other all along.

相視而笑.definition: (idiom) to look at each other and smile

相親.definition: blind date; arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1]); to be deeply attached to each other

相親相愛.definition: (idiom) (of siblings, spouses etc) very close to each other; inseparable; devoted to each other

相親角.definition: "matchmaking corner", a gathering in a park for parents who seek marriage partners for their adult children by connecting with other parents who put up posters displaying their unmarried child's details

相認.definition: to know each other; to recognize; to identify; to acknowledge (an old relationship)

相識.definition: to get to know each other; acquaintance

相距.definition: distance apart; separated by a given distance

相輕.definition: to hold each other in low regard

相迎.definition: to welcome sb; to greet sb

相通.definition: interlinked; connected; communicating; in communication; accommodating

相逢.definition: to meet (by chance); to come across

相連.definition: to link; to join; link; connection

相遇.definition: to meet; to encounter; to come across

相違.definition: to conflict with (an idea or opinion etc); to depart from (established norms or standards etc)

相配.definition: to match; to fit; to pair well

相配人.definition: match (couple); persons well suited for each other

相配物.definition: thing that is well suited; pet animal that suits its owner

相間.definition: to alternate; to follow one another

相關.definition: related; relevant; pertinent; to be interrelated; (statistics) correlation

相隨.definition: to tag along (with sb); (in combination with 與|与[yu3] or 和[he2]) to accompany (sb); (fig.) (of one situation) to go hand in hand (with another)

相面.definition: fortune telling based on the subject's face

相體裁衣.definition: lit. tailor the clothes to fit the body (idiom); fig. act according to real circumstances
